channel.title: boto3 on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in boto3 on Memo Tut

item.title: In AWS SDK for Python (Boto3), let's use Resource API rather than Client API
item.description: #Introduction This article is AWS Beginner Advent Calendar 2019 This is the 14th day article. I would appreciate if you could point out any mistakes. wrap up In Boto3, there are resource APIs (which are called with boto3.reosurce(‘service name’)) depending on the service. The resource API is more abstract than the client API and can be implemented without writing unnecessary information, so if each API can do the same, it is better to use the resource API first.

item.title: When outputting S3 list with Boto3, use Bucket().objects.filter instead of list_objects_v2
item.description: # Low-level API and high-level API It is boto3 which is aws python library, but there is a low level API which is a naive API and an object oriented high level API which wraps it. Manipulating S3 Objects with Boto3 (High Level API and Low Level API)-Qiita https://qiita.com/sokutou-metsu/items/5ba7531117224ee5e8af I used to use the low-level API client.list_objects_v2 to output the list of S3, but there is a corresponding high-level API, resource.
